sndlib.core.network
Class Network

java.lang.Object
  sndlib.core.network.Network

public final class Network
extends java.lang.Object

This class is the root element of a network definition tree.

It provides the topology of the network (the nodes and the connections between them) as well as the traffic demands. More precisely, a Network consists of Nodes, Links, Demands and AdmissiblePaths. The Network object acts as a factory for constructing these elements.

A Network object maintains several invariants:

  • For all links e in the network: The source and target node of e are also contained in the network.
  • For all demands d in the network: The source and target node of d are also contained in the network.
  • If a node is removed from the network then all of its incident links and demands will be also removed.
  • For all admissible paths p of all demands in the network: All links of p are also contained in the network.
  • If a link is removed from the network then that link is also removed from all admissible paths of all demands in the network.
    If an admissible path is empty after removing a link then that path will be removed from its parent demand.

Author:
Roman Klaehne
See Also:
NetworkUtils, Node, Link, Demand, AdmissiblePath, CapacityModule

setNodeCoordinatesType

public void setNodeCoordinatesType(NodeCoordinatesType nodeCoordType)
Sets the type of the node coordinates in this network.
The specified type is inherited by all nodes currently in this network and by those which will be added subsequently.

Parameters:
nodeCoordType - the coordinates type
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified coordinates type is NodeCoordinatesType.GEOGRAPHICAL and there is a node in this network whose coordinates cannot be interpreted as a geographical longitude and latitude

newDemand

public Demand newDemand(java.lang.String demandId,
                        Node first,
                        Node second)
Constructs a new Demand in this network.

Parameters:
demandId - the ID of the demand
first - the first (source) node of the demand
second - the second (target) node of the demand
Returns:
a new created demand
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if any of the given nodes do not belong to this network; or if a demand with the given ID already exists in this network.

newAdmissiblePath

public AdmissiblePath newAdmissiblePath(java.lang.String pathId,
                                        java.util.List<Link> links,
                                        Demand demand)
Creates a new admissible path for the given demand.

The path is built from the given list of links.

Parameters:
pathId - the ID of the path
links - the links of the path
demand - the demand to create the admissible path for
Returns:
the new created path
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if given demand already has a path with the specified ID
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the given demand or one of the given links does not belong to this network
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given list of links is empty

Parameters:

Returns:

removeLink

public boolean removeLink(Link link)
Removes the given Link from this network.

The given link will be removed automatically from all admissible paths of all demands in this network. If an admissible path remains empty after removing the link it is also removed from its parent demand.

Parameters:
link - the link to remove
Returns:
true if and only if the given link was removed; false otherwise.

removeNode

public boolean removeNode(Node node)
Removes the given Node from this network.

All links and demands which are incident to the given node will be removed automatically.

Parameters:
node - the node to remove
Returns:
true if and only if the given node was removed; false otherwise.
